intro: Omphalodes scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpion weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
